jinx.reason: The Acrobat does not die on a Minstrel night.
If a player registers as both a Minion and a Demon, the Alsaahir must guess that player as a Demon in order for their guess to be correct.
If a player registers as both a Minion and a Demon, the Alsaahir must guess that player as a Demon in order for their guess to be correct.
Yes, but don't. We have yet to encounter a situation where it was fun for the players to have the Spy or Recluse misregister to the Alsaahir's ability.
Yes, but don't. We have yet to encounter a situation where it was fun for the players to have the Spy or Recluse misregister to the Alsaahir's ability.
Apprentice with a Townsfolk ability gets false information.
The sober Assassin will kill the Goon even if they are made drunk due to the effect of the Goon.
Assassin can kill a player if the Lycanthrope successfully kills a player.
The Barber that dies, then turned into the Klutz would still need to choose a player.
If the Drunk thinks they are a role that would learn information & are targeted by the Barista ability, then they get correct information.
The Barista would cause a Fortune Teller to not register the red herring as the Demon.
Only the first player chosen by the Lycanthrope would die.
The Barista on the first night can have the Pixie learn 2 roles & if they are mad about those characters can gain both abilities.
The Barista would cause a character to not register the Recluse as Evil, a Minion or a Demon.
The Barista would cause a character to not register the Spy as Good, a Townsfolk or an Outsider.
Creating a Baron does not create 2 more Outsiders.

If the Alchemist has the Boffin ability, there are so, so many fun things you can do with it. Lots of abilities that are terrible for an evil Boffin to give the Demon are fantastic for a good Alchemist Boffin to give the Demon. Just donâ€™t be too mean - this is a game, after all!

If the Demon has the Alsaahir ability, and they correctly guess the in-play Minion(s) and Demon(s), the good team wins. Unless itâ€™s a Heretic game, this isnâ€™t a helpful ability for the Boffin to give the Demon.
Go nuts.

jinx.id: Atheist: If the Demon has the Atheist ability, the Storyteller may break the rules. Pros: Shenanigans! And no oneâ€™s claiming Atheist! But cons: if the Storyteller is executed, the good team wins. Note
jinx.reason: if the Demon has the Atheist ability, the Atheistâ€™s setup condition is not followed, and the Demon & Boffin (and any other evil characters) are put into play.
Gives the Demon useful information about which good players are Outsiders, and there might be an extra outsider in play, which the Demon doesnâ€™t have to mention to anyone.
If the Demon with the Banshee ability dies, they have an active Banshee ability - but only as long as the Boffin is alive.
If the Demon has the Bounty Hunter ability, one Townsfolk is evil.

If the Demon has the Cannibal ability, they gain the ability of the recently killed executee (on top of their Demon ability). If an evil player (not the Boffin) is executed, the Demonâ€™s Cannibal ability is poisoned, but their Demon ability remains sober and healthy. If the Demon gains an ability (via their Cannibal ability) that could cause the Demonâ€™s alignment to change, the Demon gains this ability but cannot turn good due to this ability.

The Boffin wakes to their own ability on the 1st night (when they learn what ability the Demon has). The Demon does not register to the Chambermaid if/when they wake to their good character ability, because they are waking due to the Boffinâ€™s ability, not their Demon ability. However, the Demon still registers as waking to the Chambermaid any time they wake to their Demon ability.

jinx.id: Choirboy: If the Demon has the Choirboy ability, there must be a King in play. Bonus
jinx.reason: The Demon can kill the King and learn that it was themself all along!

In certain setups, the Storyteller could use the Clockmaker ability to tell the Demon where the Recluse is sitting. Or, in a Poppy Grower game, the Clockmaker ability could help the Demon narrow down where their Minion(s) might be.
Screwing with a good Townsfolkâ€™s ability for 3 days and 3 nights? Donâ€™t mind if we do!
If the Demon has the Engineer ability, they can change the composition of the evil team!
Yes, if the Demon has the Exorcist ability and they pick themself, they will be told that they are the Exorcist and then they will not wake to their Demon ability that night.

If the Demon has the Hatter ability and dies while the Boffin is sober & alive, the evil team can choose which Minion(s) and Demon(s) to be. If the Boffin and/or the Demon changes players, this is treated as a new iteration of the Boffin ability & the Demonâ€™s good character ability can be refreshed.

Because the High Priestess ability lets the Storyteller tell the player with that ability who they should talk to most, the Storyteller can use this ability to help the Demon coordinate with evils and/or effectively bluff correct High Priestess information.
If the Demon has the King ability, and kills themself, the Choirboy learns that the player who died last night is the Demon.

If the Demon has the Librarian ability, the Storyteller should be careful about what Outsider they show the Demon. Please do not show them the Damsel or the Heretic or anything else that would fundamentally break the game; most other Outsiders are fair game! Librarian is an especially great ability for a Fang Gu.

If the Demon has the Lycanthrope ability and they target a good player, their Demon kills will not go through that night. This can be especially fun for a Demon with a unique kill pattern (like the Shabaloth or Po) if they want to confuse the town about what Demon is in play.

If the Demon has & uses the Philosopher ability, an in-play Townsfolk with the ability the Demon-Philosopher gained would be drunked by the Demonâ€™s Philosopher ability. However, if/when the Boffin is drunk, poisoned, or dies, the Demon loses the Philosopher ability, so the previously Philo-drunk Townsfolk is now sober.

If the Demon has the Pixie ability and is mad about the Townsfolk they were shown via this ability, they will gain the ability shown when the player dies (as long as the Boffin is alive, sober, & healthy when that happens!)
Great for an Alchemist Boffin, not so much otherwise.
If the Demon preaches the Boffin, they no longer have the Preacher ability.
If the Demon dies while they have the Puzzlemaster ability, the Puzzlemaster ability stays active. When the Boffin ability is no longer in play, the Puzzlemaster ability goes away.
The Recluse can get an ability from the Boffin! But if they do, the real Demon would not get an ability, which is a very poor use of a Minion. An Alchemist-Boffin, however...
If the Demon chooses themself with their Sailor ability, their Sailor ability is drunk but their Demon ability is unaffected.

If the Demon chooses themself with the Snake Charmer ability, the Demon swaps characters with themself (mechanically this doesnâ€™t do anything, but technically that is what happens), and then their Snake Charmer ability is poisoned due to itself. The Demon ability is unaffected.
Gives the Minions bluffs!

If the Demon has the Soldier ability, they are safe from their Demon ability. If they are the Imp, this means they cannot kill themself to turn a Minion into the Imp, and if they are the Fang Gu, they cannot jump to an Outsider while they have the Soldier ability. Separately, the Soldier themself is safe from the Demonâ€™s Boffin ability (e.g. if the Demon has the Virgin ability, the Soldier can not be executed and die by nominating the Demon).
Can see what ability the Demon has because the token would be next to them on the grimoire.
When the Demon dies, someone (ideally a good player) is drunk for as long as the Boffin has their ability.
Juggler targeted by the Bone-Collector does allows to get information if they Juggled during the day.
The cannibal wakes to learn their information after all poisoning and killing occurs, so might die before they would be woken up with information.
The cannibal wakes to learn their information after all poisoning and killing occurs, so might die before they would be woken up with information.
The cannibal wakes to learn their information after all poisoning and killing occurs, so might die before they would be woken up with information.
The cannibal wakes to learn their information after all poisoning and killing occurs, so might die before they would be woken up with information.
The cannibal wakes to learn their information after all poisoning and killing occurs, so might die before they would be woken up with information.

If Pixie is droisoned night 1, you can show them any Townsfolk token, whether in play or not. You then place the Mad token next to any player you like. When that player dies, the Pixie gains the Townsfolk ability they were shown regardless of the actual ability that player had.
The Acrobat dies if the Drunk is an alive living neighbour.
Chambermaid learns of the 'Drunk' waking as the role they think they.
Chiorboy can be Drunk regardless of if King is in play or not.
A Drunk Fortune Teller does not have a red herring.
The Drunk who thinks they are a Townsfolk who selects the Goon with their 'ability' does trigger the Goon & becomes drunk.
The King cannot be made the Drunk if the Choirboy is in play
A Drunk who believes they are the Ravenkeeper is woken & given information.
A Drunk who believes they are the Sage is woken & given information.
If the Good Twin is turned Evil by the Mezepheles, then a new twin must be assigned & both players are told.
An Outsider chosen by the Monk cannot be jumped to.
The Pit-Hag's arbitrary deaths can protect & kill the same player to stop a Fang-Gu jump.
The Gossip can add their 'Kill' token to any player, even if they are protected due to another ability such as the Fool.
If the Lycanthrope's target does not die the protection due to the Lycanthrope's ability does not activate.
The Mayor can redirect the death to another player, even if they are protected by another ability such as the Fool.
If a Godfather is created the night after an Outsider dies during the day, the Godfather can kill.
The Lunatic who thinks they are a Demon who selects the Goon with their 'ability' does trigger the Goon & becomes drunk.
If the Lycanthrope's target does not die, the protection due to the Lycanthrope's ability does not activate.
The Goon only changes alignment if chosen at night, so the Moonchild can kill the Goon.
The Gossip can add their 'Kill' token to any player, even if they are protected due to another ability such as the Innkeeper.
The Gossip can add their 'Kill' token to any player, even if they are protected due to another ability such as the Monk.
The Gossip can add their 'Kill' token to any player, even if they are protected due to another ability such as the Sailor.
The Gossip can add their 'Kill' token to any player, even if they are protected due to another ability such as the Soldier.
If the Minion whose ability the Alchemist has comes into play, the Alchemist gains a new ability instead.
An Apprentice with a Minion ability is not a Minion and is not affected by the Hatter ability
The Bounty Hunter evil Townsfolk is not a Minion or Demon, so does not choose a new character.
A player waking to make only a Hatter choice and nothing else does not count as waking to the Chambermaid - it's not their own ability.
An evil Cult Leader is not a Minion or Demon, so does not choose a new character.
Even if the Minions have changed characters, a used guess is still used.

If an Evil Twin ability comes into play through the Hatter, you should wake each twin individually to show them who their twin is and what character it is. Remember that the good twin doesn't have to be alive and generally shouldn't be if this happens in late game as this can mean the good team cannot win.
If a player becomes a Fearmonger, their choices as their previous character arenâ€™t relevant to the Fearmonger announcement, their first pick will cause an announcement regardless of who it is.
If a Godfather comes into play, they'd immediately learn the in-play Outsiders, whether those Outsiders are dead or alive.
A Lilâ€™ Monsta holder would be able to choose another Demon, as usual for Demons.
A Lleech coming into play would immediately select a host, then follow that by choosing a kill.
A Lunatic can be given the choice to change characters as if they were the real Demon and a Hatter had died, regardless of whether the actual Hatter died or not.
If a player chooses Marionette with the Hatter ability, you should tell them they're a good character and tell the Demon they are the Marionette. There may also be a future jinx for the Marionette.
If the in-play Minion abilities change due to the Hatter, this does not affect a Plague Doctor granted Storyteller ability.
A Po that comes into play would have the choice to kill no-one or 1 player - choices as a previous character are not relevant for the Po ability.
A Minion chosen by the Preacher that changes character is still affected by the Preacher ability.
If the Demon changes away from being a Pukka, the previously poisoned player immediately sobers and will not die tonight.
It's possible to wake the Recluse as if they were a Minion or Demon to allow them to change characters, but this is very rarely fun, so recommended against.
The Undertaker learns the information that was true at the time of execution, regardless of whether the executed player's character changes afterwards.

A Demon that changes from a Vigormortis to something else while having killed Minions to maintain their abiities in death will cause those abilities to immediately be lost. However, if the Vigor stays in play, a Vigor-killed Minion can change character and continue to use their new ability.
An already-dead player that chooses to become a Zombuul does not return to life as a once-killed Zombuul, they are already dead.
The only restriction is not to give the one player you would have given if it was not a Vortox game. It does not have to be the least helpful player to talk to.
A protected Imp cannot kill themself & pass on the Imp to a Minion.
The Pit-Hag's arbitrary death can protect & kill the same player to stop an Imp passing.
If the Lycanthrope's target does not die, the protection due to the Lycanthrope's ability does not activate.
The Mayor can redirect the death to another player, even if they are protected by another ability such as the Innkeeper.
If the Pixie is drunk on the first night you can show them any role. If they are drunk on the night they would gain then they never gain an ability.
The Philosopher with the Juggler's ability, their first day is the day after they turn thus they do not get information the night they turn, even if they juggled that day.
A Juggler brought back to life's first day is the next day thus they do not get information the night they are resurrected, even if they juggled that day.
The Kazali has to choose their Minions so that the Storyteller knows what's in play in order to give the Alchemist their ability.
A Balloonist could be replaced by the Kazali, but because their setup effect can be duplicated by the Kazali's setup effect, this is legitimate.
Minions waking to learn they have become Minions are not waking due to their own ability, but the Kazali's.
Minions are informed about the Damsel after the Kazali has made all their choices. So if the Damsel is chosen by the Kazali to become a Minion, the Minions do not learn there was a Damsel in play.
While the Lunatic ability technically requires any Demon to learn which players a Lunatikazali picked to become Minions, the Storyteller might choose not to do so.

If the Magician is in play, the Storyteller should put the Kazali to sleep when waking each Minion to tell them their character has changed, then show both the Demon and the Magician during the Minion info step.
If the Poppy Grower is in play, the Storyteller should put the Kazali to sleep when waking each Minion to tell them their character has changed and then run the Poppy Grower as normal.
Unlucky Kazali! You might be one Minion down now ðŸ˜‰ Better pay attention during Demon Info to make sure you get told all the players you picked!

The Storyteller is not a player and thus cannot be shown to the Knight, even if the Atheist is on the script. If the Atheist is in play, however, the Storyteller can be shown, because the Storyteller may break game rules.
A Knight cannot see any Legion player in their info, regardless of if they're registering as a Minion.
The Recluse may or may not be able to be shown to the Knight - it's the Storyteller's choice of how they register the Recluse.
A Knight in a Vortox game learns 2 players, one of which is the Demon - very powerful stuff! If you can confirm it's a Vortox gameâ€¦
The Good Twin holding Lil' Monsta that is executed & killed will cause Evil to win.
The Lil' Monsta will still kill, but the player holding the token does not.
The Goblin holding Lil' Monsta that is executed & killed will cause Good to win.
The Saint holding Lil' Monsta that is executed & killed will cause Good to win.
Needs to remember to guess an extra Minion if they think itâ€™s a Lord Of Typhon game!
If the Balloonist becomes a Minion during setup, the Outsider count is not impacted, because the Lord Of Typhon allows for any number of Outsiders to be in play.

Still adds 2 Outsiders at setup, but the Lord Of Typhonâ€™s setup ability means any number of Outsiders count may be in play. However, taking away all the Outsiders the Baron would have added is real sucky for the Baron, so please donâ€™t do that.

The Evil Townsfolk must be in the line at setup, and the Lord Of Typhon does not necessarily have to neighbor two Minions if there is an Evil Townsfolk in play at the start of the game. However, Evil Townsfolk who enter play after setup (due to a Mez word, Philo-Bounty Hunter, etc.) do not have to be in the line, as the line itself is a setup ability.

The Lord Of Typhon does not wake to their own ability on the first night. Minions learning that they are Minions is part of setup & also do not register to the Chambermaid (though they would register if they woke due to their own Minion ability).

The Minions see the Magician as the Demon, and the Demon sees the Magician as a Minion. In a Lord of Typhon game, if the Magician isnâ€™t next to the line of evil characters, this may make the Magician obvious to the evil team. However, this can be useful - if the Magician senses that the evil team is coordinated, theyâ€™ll realize itâ€™s a Lord of Typhon game, which can be exceptionally useful information for world-building.
The Demon does not learn the Minions, but the Lord of Typhon knows that at least both of their neighbors are Minions, and can coordinate with the two players sitting directly next to them.

The intent of misregistration abilities is that they do not begin until after setup. In playtest, we found that it was never fun for the players to have the Spy or Recluse misregister at setup to be out of or in the line (respectively),

The intent of misregistration abilities is that they do not begin until after setup. In playtest, we found that it was never fun for the players to have the Spy or Recluse misregister at setup to be out of or in the line (respectively),
I shouldnâ€™t have to say this, but because itâ€™s been asked multiple timesâ€¦ If the Snake Charmer hits the Lord Of Typhon, no, their neighbors do not become evil Minions.
The Soldier doesnâ€™t have an active ability during setup, so they are not safe from becoming a Minion to the Lord Of Typhon.
The Chambermaid learns of the Lunatic waking, even on the first night as this is due to their ability.
The Lunatic can be told they were selected by the Exorcist.
Any kills that are prevented due to the Lycanthrope's protection register as an abnormality to the Mathematician.
The Mayor can bounce the Lycanthrope kill & it still continue to prevent other players from dying.
If the Lycanthrope's target does not die, the protection due to the Lycanthrope's ability does not activate.
If the Lycanthrope's target does not die, the protection due to the Lycanthrope's ability does not activate.
Chiorboy can be Marionette regardless of if King is in play or not.
The King cannot be made the Marionette if the Choirboy is in play
The Snake Charmer poisoning themselves does not register as abnormal to the Mathematician
The Mayor can redirect the death to another player, even if they are protected by another ability such as the Monk.
The Mayor can redirect the death to another player, even if they are protected by another ability such as the Soldier.
If a player turned by the Mezepheles is executed the Cannibal is drunk.
If the player turned by the Mezepheles was the red herring, the token is moved to a good player.
The Goon can revert back to Good the same night they are turned by the Mezepheles. The Goon would not make the Mezepheles drunk.
If the grandchild is turned Evil by the Mezepheles, then they remain the grandchild.
If the Good player who knows about the Widow is turned by the Mezepheles, then a new player is informed.
If the Pixie is drunk on the first night you can show them any role. If they are drunk on the night they would gain then they never gain an ability
If the Mutant causes a second execution, then the Storyteller may show 1, or both, of the executed roles.
A player protected by the Monk is not poisoned from No Dashii.
If the Pixie is drunk on the first night you can show them any role. If they are drunk on the night they would gain then they never gain an ability.
The Soldier cannot poisoned from No Dashii whilst sober and healthy.
A sober Bounty Hunter can be shown an evil Ogre.

If a good Ogre is executed, the Cannibal gains the Ogre ability, wakes to pick a player, and becomes the alignment of that player. They are not told their alignment. The next time a player dies to execution, the Cannibal loses the Ogre ability but stays the alignment of the player they chose for the rest of the game. If an evil Ogre is executed, the Cannibal is poisoned due to the Cannibalâ€™s ability.
If a good Ogre says the Mez word, they turn evil and learn that they are now evil. If an evil Ogre says the Mez word, nothing happens, and a good player may still say the word and turn evil.
The Spy does not see which player the Ogre selected, but may see the Ogreâ€™s alignment.
The Widow does not see which player the Ogre selected, but may see the Ogreâ€™s alignment.
If the Ojo chooses Goon and is the first player to do so tonight, they are made drunk and change the Goon's alignment.
The Demon learns the player a Lunatic-Ojo chose, not the character they chose.
The Ojo killing a different character to the one they chose is not a malfunction, it's part of the Ojo's own ability.
If the Ojo chooses Mayor, it's still possible to bounce it to another player.
If the Ojo chooses Recluse, the Recluse might register as something else and cause a Storyteller-choice death.
The Spy might register as a good character the Ojo chose and die insteadâ€¦ You should think very carefully about whether this is a good idea.
Has no effect on Organ Grinder with Barista 2. Barista 1 just ensures they are sober and healthy and always affect voting.
The Beggar is still bound by their voting restriction, even though their eyes are closed.
The votes on their nominations are still affected by the Organ Grinder.
The votes on their nominations are still affected by the Organ Grinder.
Cults are not votes, so the Organ Grinder does not interact with calls for cults.
Public actions can be taken while players have their eyes closed to vote.
The death prevention happens when players are executed, so only matters at the point of execution, not during voting.
Public actions can be taken while players have their eyes closed to vote.
The death prevention happens when players are executed, so only matters at the point of execution, not during voting.

Can confirm who the Organ Grinder is by nominating them after a blind vote has already happened that day and the consequent vote happening with eyes open. If the OG is killed between votes, this does not mean the town would learn who is on the block and with how many votes. Future nominations would simply be run open-eyed and results announced - "X votes is/is not enough and player B is/is not on the block" and the town would be able to work out the prior votes based on this information.
Doesnâ€™t work with the Organ Grinder. Iâ€™d recommend Storytellers donâ€™t use the Gunslinger with an Organ Grinder on the script.
An Imp that starpasses to an Organ Grinder will probably be found out pretty quick when thereâ€™s no Organ Grinder ability the next day!
A Judge forces a nomination to pass or fail, which is completely independent of the vote count, so the Judge can force a vote on an Organ Grinder to pass even if the Organ Grinder did not vote.
The death prevention happens when players are executed, so only matters at the point of execution, not during voting.
The death prevention happens when players are executed, so only matters at the point of execution, not during voting.
The death prevention happens when players are executed, so only matters at the point of execution, not during voting.
Public actions can be taken while players have their eyes closed to vote.
The death prevention happens when players are executed, so only matters at the point of execution, not during voting.
If the Pixie is drunk on the first night you can show them any role. If they are drunk on the night they would gain then they never gain an ability.
The Pit-Hag's arbitrary deaths can kill the Zombuul twice in order for them to be dead.
If the Gambler gambles incorrectly & the Pit-hag creates a new Demon, then the Gambler can be prevented from dying.
If a Gossip is created, their previous day's Gossip can kill a player.
The Recluse can stop the Pit-Hag from creating an Evil character.
The Pit-Hag's arbitrary deaths can protect & kill the same player to stop an a Sage, that would be killed by the Demon, from learning information.
The Pit-Hag can be prevented from creating a Good character due to the Spy's ability.

If Pixie is droisoned night 1, you can show them any Townsfolk token, whether in play or not. You then place the Mad token next to any player you like. When that player dies, the Pixie gains the Townsfolk ability they were shown regardless of the actual ability that player had.

If Pixie is droisoned night 1, you can show them any Townsfolk token, whether in play or not. You then place the Mad token next to any player you like. When that player dies, the Pixie gains the Townsfolk ability they were shown regardless of the actual ability that player had.
The Alchemist ability counts as being in play when the Storyteller is choosing which ability to gain.
The Storyteller is not a Minion even if they have a Minion ability and therefore cannot be seen by the Balloonist.
The Storyteller is not a player and cannot be affected by the Barista.
The Storyteller is not evil even if they have a Minion ability and therefore cannot be seen by the Bounty Hunter.
The Storyteller is not a Minion, so cannot guess the Damsel.
The Engineer does not affect the Storyteller as they are not themselves a Minion.
The Storyteller isn't a player and doesn't have an alignment, so they cannot affect the Goon's alignment or be made drunk by the Goon.
The Storyteller might gain a Minion ability, but they will not be a Minion, so they cannot become an Imp through the Imp ability.
The King cannot learn the character whose ability the Storyteller has.
A Plague Doctor death can result in a Minion ability in a Legion game.
The Storyteller is not drunked by the Minstrel, so a Plague-Doctor-granted Minion ability would still be functioning on a Minstrel night.
The Preacher cannot select the Storyteller and therefore cannot remove their Minion ability.
The Recluse might affect the ability the Storyteller gains by registering as a Minion being in play.
A Plague Doctor death can result in a Minion ability in a Riot game.

If Pixie is droisoned night 1, you can show them any Townsfolk token, whether in play or not. You then place the Mad token next to any player you like. When that player dies, the Pixie gains the Townsfolk ability they were shown regardless of the actual ability that player had.
A Politician who successfully makes the entire good team believe that the Atheist is evil and manages to get them to execute down to final 2 can be the only player that wins in an Atheist game.

With multiple Politician abilities in play, there can be multiple players playing for the evil team. However, only the most responsible player can change teams, so theyâ€™re in direct competition with one another. If any of these die while they have the Politician ability, they maintain the ability even if dead and can change alignments to win at the end of the game.

Itâ€™s very rarely fun to make the Politician the good twin as they can campaign for their own execution, never mentioning that theyâ€™re a twin, then win the game with evil as a result (itâ€™s pretty hard to argue they werenâ€™t most responsible in that situation!)

If the game ends due to the Fearmonger ability targeting the Politician or the Politician being executed second in a Leviathan game or on a Mastermind day, the good team loses. If you think that the Politician was nonetheless the main influence in causing this to happen, the Politician can change alignments and win with the evil team, this does not then cause the evil team to lose instead, the game end condition was already evaluated.
The Politicianâ€™s changing alignments is decided after the Heretic impacts the result of who actually won the game.

Politician/Legion is not a fun combination â€“ the Politician is incentivised to vote on literally any execution but their own and be the single good vote Legion needs to pass every vote â€“ again itâ€™s difficult to claim they werenâ€™t most responsible here.,

If the game ends due to the Fearmonger ability targeting the Politician or the Politician being executed second in a Leviathan game or on a Mastermind day, the good team loses. If you think that the Politician was nonetheless the main influence in causing this to happen, the Politician can change alignments and win with the evil team, this does not then cause the evil team to lose instead, the game end condition was already evaluated.

If the game ends due to the Fearmonger ability targeting the Politician or the Politician being executed second in a Leviathan game or on a Mastermind day, the good team loses. If you think that the Politician was nonetheless the main influence in causing this to happen, the Politician can change alignments and win with the evil team, this does not then cause the evil team to lose instead, the game end condition was already evaluated.

The Politician can say the Mezepheles word and then betray the evil team to win with good â€“ theyâ€™re not restricted to only switching from good to evil at the end of the game, itâ€™s also legitimate for them to switch the other way.

With multiple Politician abilities in play, there can be multiple players playing for the evil team. However, only the most responsible player can change teams, so theyâ€™re in direct competition with one another. If any of these die while they have the Politician ability, they maintain the ability even if dead and can change alignments to win at the end of the game.
If a Politician is in a Revolutionary pair, itâ€™s the Politician who must be most responsible for the game end in order to potentially flip both playersâ€™ alignments, not the pair as a duo.
The Grandmother can't die to their own ability on a Princess night.

If the Pixie gains the Princess ability, and they nominate & execute a player on the day they gain the Princess ability, the Demon doesn't kill that night. The Pixie does not learn if they gain the Princess ability.

If the Princess is drunk/poisoned during the day but sober at night, their ability still works. If the Princess is sober during the day but drunk/poisoned at night, their ability will not work if triggered and the Demon can kill.

If the Princess is drunk/poisoned during the day but sober at night, their ability still works. If the Princess is sober during the day but drunk/poisoned at night, their ability will not work if triggered and the Demon can kill.

If the Princess is drunk/poisoned during the day but sober at night, their ability still works. If the Princess is sober during the day but drunk/poisoned at night, their ability will not work if triggered and the Demon can kill.

If the Princess is drunk/poisoned during the day but sober at night, their ability still works. If the Princess is sober during the day but drunk/poisoned at night, their ability will not work if triggered and the Demon can kill.

If the Princess is drunk/poisoned during the day but sober at night, their ability still works. If the Princess is sober during the day but drunk/poisoned at night, their ability will not work if triggered and the Demon can kill.

If the Princess is drunk/poisoned during the day but sober at night, their ability still works. If the Princess is sober during the day but drunk/poisoned at night, their ability will not work if triggered and the Demon can kill.
The Princess never wakes to their own ability.

If the Demon changes characters, the Princess ability still prevents the Demon from killing. If the Princess changes characters, it's considered a new iteration of the Princess ability & the next day is treated as the Princess's 1st day.

If the Demon changes characters, the Princess ability still prevents the Demon from killing. If the Princess changes characters, it's considered a new iteration of the Princess ability & the next day is treated as the Princess's 1st day.

If the Demon changes characters, the Princess ability still prevents the Demon from killing. If the Princess changes characters, it's considered a new iteration of the Princess ability & the next day is treated as the Princess's 1st day.

If the Demon changes characters, the Princess ability still prevents the Demon from killing. If the Princess changes characters, it's considered a new iteration of the Princess ability & the next day is treated as the Princess's 1st day.
If the Princess ability prevents the Demon from killing, that's a Math 1.
If the Philosopher gains the Princess ability, and they nominate & execute a player on the day they gain the Princess ability, the Demon doesn't kill that night.
If the Huntsman turns the Damsel into the Princess, and the Damsel-turned-Princess nominates & executes a player that day, the Demon doesn't kill that night.
If the Princess is resurrected, it's considered a new iteration of the Princess ability. If the Princess nominates & executes a player that day, the Demon doesn't kill that night.
If the Princess is resurrected, it's considered a new iteration of the Princess ability. If the Princess nominates & executes a player that day, the Demon doesn't kill that night.
If the Alchemist has a killing ability, the Alchemist can still kill on a Princess night.
Can't use their abilities on a Princess night because they cannot die to the Demon. ,,
Can't use their abilities on a Princess night because they cannot die to the Demon. ,,
Can't use their abilities on a Princess night because they cannot die to the Demon. ,,
If the Princess-nominated player survives execution, the Demon doesn't kill tonight.
If the Princess-nominated player survives execution, the Demon doesn't kill tonight.
If the Princess-nominated player survives execution, the Demon doesn't kill tonight.

If the Princess nominates & executes the Goon on their 1st day, the Princess's ability still triggers that night. If the Demon is the 1st player to pick the Goon on a Princess night, the Goon becomes the Demon's alignment.

The Moonchild ability triggers after the Demon kills, so if the Moonchild is executed and picks the Good Princess, the Princess still prevents the Demon from killing before they die to the Moonchild's ability.
If the Princess nominates a player who is then executed for any reason, the Storyteller may treat this as satisfying the Princess's requirement to nominate & execute a player.
If the Princess nominates a player who is then executed for any reason, the Storyteller may treat this as satisfying the Princess's requirement to nominate & execute a player.
If the Princess nominates a player who is then executed for any reason, the Storyteller may treat this as satisfying the Princess's requirement to nominate & execute a player.
Still gets a kill if an Outsider died during the Princess's 1st day & the Princess used their ability.
If the Pit-Hag creates a new Demon, deaths tonight are arbitrary, and the Princess's ability has no effect.
If the Vizier pushes the Princess's nomination through on the Princess's 1st day, this triggers the Princess night.
Can still kill by saying their phrase during the day after a Princess night, but can't kill that night.

If the Princess nominates & executes a player on their 1st day, the Pukka picks a player to poison that night. The previously poisoned player cannot die, so that player becomes healthy. If the Pukka poisons the Princess on a Princess night, the Pukka regains the ability to kill in time to kill the previously poisoned player.
The Fang Gu can't jump on a Princess night because the Fang Gu can't kill an Outsider in order to turn them into the new Fang Gu.
A player protected by the Monk is not poisoned by the Pukka.
If the Ravenkeeper dies to the Pukka, they receive poisoned information.
The Soldier cannot be poisoned by the Pukka whilst sober and healthy.
If the Cannibal has an â€œeven if deadâ€ ability, such as the Recluse, the Cannibal keeps that ability when they die (but loses their Cannibal ability).
Evil / Recluse / Evil seating pattern can register as a Chef 1.
The Recluse cannot produce a Clockmaker 0.
If the Lycanthrope's target does not die, the protection due to the Lycanthrope's ability does not activate.
If you have the Recluse register as a Demon, the original Snake Charmer becomes a Good Recluse.
The Cannibal can gain any ability that the Spy registers as.
Red herring check is not ongoing & therefore can be on the Spy
The Spy can register as any Townsfolk for the Pixie & the Pixie will gain that ability when the Spy dies

The Storyteller is not a player and thus cannot be shown to the Steward, even if the Atheist is on the script. If the Atheist is in play, however, the Storyteller can be shown, because the Storyteller may break game rules.
The Cult Leader is always a valid target for the Steward as they don't change alignment until later in the first night.
The Steward can learn the good twin, but this might not be fun depending on the players and other info involved.
Despite having drawn a blue token, the Marionette is not a valid player for the Steward to learn.
The Recluse may or may not be able to be shown to the Steward - it's the Storyteller's choice of how they register the Recluse.
The Spy may or may not be able to be shown to the Steward - it's the Storyteller's choice of how they register the Spy.
The Steward learns an evil player in a Vortox game.
If the Barber dies while there is no Demon, nothing happens.
If the Engineer chooses to change the Demon while there is no Demon in play, there is no effect.

Ouch. Thatâ€™s not a good time. Thatâ€™s a drunk Summoner, a Goon that turns evil and an evil team, including that Goon, that immediately loses (all assuming the Summoner is the first to select the Goon that night).
This is a potentially massively unfun combination, so think incredibly carefully before putting these both on a script together.
Itâ€™s worth thinking carefully before putting Summoner in a Revolutionary game thatâ€™s being played for accessibility reasons.
If the Summoner chooses a dead player to be the Zombuul, theyâ€™re already dead and do not become a registering-as-dead Zombuul, they are just dead and the good team wins.

If Pixie is droisoned night 1, you can show them any Townsfolk token, whether in play or not. You then place the Mad token next to any player you like. When that player dies, the Pixie gains the Townsfolk ability they were shown regardless of the actual ability that player had.
A player protected by the Monk is not poisoned by the Vigormortis.
The Pit-Hag's arbitrary deaths can protect & kill the same player to stop a Minion retaining their ability & poisoning a Townsfolk.

If Pixie is droisoned night 1, you can show them any Townsfolk token, whether in play or not. You then place the Mad token next to any player you like. When that player dies, the Pixie gains the Townsfolk ability they were shown regardless of the actual ability that player had.
The Soldier cannot poisoned by the Vigormortis whilst sober and healthy.
An Apprentice Vizier acts just like a regular one, including the fact they do not die if exiled.

The Storyteller can simulate a Vizier in an Atheist game, but the Vizier player hasn't got much incentive to play along as this confirms to them that it's an Atheist game, so it's best to choose the Atheist themselves for this purpose. This is because being announced as Vizier makes it less likely for them to be believed as Atheist right away, so many players will wait a day or two to try and point out other abnormalities from the Atheist ability.
If the Vizier character is swapped, all players immediately learn who the new Vizier is, if they are alive.
The Barista double has no effect on the Vizier.
A Vizier can force a Butcher nomination in the same way as they can force a standard one.
The Clockmaker can be game-solving in single Minion games if the Vizier is in play. Script writers should consider this with care.

A good Cult Leader can vote for everything the Vizier wants then be turned late in the game. Ditto Outsiders in a Fang Gu script (it doesnâ€™t even have to be in play for the Vizier to promise it to an Outsider) or the Goon or Politician or a player that negotiates with the Mezepheles to keep the word until later. These plays are very rarely fun, even for the players directly involved, so itâ€™s probably just worth agreeing in your group not to do so.

A Vizier cannot die to the Doomsayer, so evil players must be careful when Doomsaying with a Vizier in play lest they either kill their own Demon as the only remaining evil option to die or have no-one die because the ST targets the Vizier with the Doomsayer ability.
Better be careful with your voting as good players!,

A good Cult Leader can vote for everything the Vizier wants then be turned late in the game. Ditto Outsiders in a Fang Gu script (it doesnâ€™t even have to be in play for the Vizier to promise it to an Outsider) or the Goon or Politician or a player that negotiates with the Mezepheles to keep the word until later. These plays are very rarely fun, even for the players directly involved, so itâ€™s probably just worth agreeing in your group not to do so.
Better be careful with your voting as good players!,

A good Cult Leader can vote for everything the Vizier wants then be turned late in the game. Ditto Outsiders in a Fang Gu script (it doesnâ€™t even have to be in play for the Vizier to promise it to an Outsider) or the Goon or Politician or a player that negotiates with the Mezepheles to keep the word until later. These plays are very rarely fun, even for the players directly involved, so itâ€™s probably just worth agreeing in your group not to do so.
If the Vizier chooses to execute before the Gunslinger has a chance to shoot, the Gunslinger gets no chance.
The Judge can use their ability during or after votes, so might force a success before the Vizier can, but cannot force a failure if the Vizier has already forced a success.
Better be careful with your voting as good players!,
Better be careful with your voting as good players!,

A good Cult Leader can vote for everything the Vizier wants then be turned late in the game. Ditto Outsiders in a Fang Gu script (it doesnâ€™t even have to be in play for the Vizier to promise it to an Outsider) or the Goon or Politician or a player that negotiates with the Mezepheles to keep the word until later. These plays are very rarely fun, even for the players directly involved, so itâ€™s probably just worth agreeing in your group not to do so.
Viziers should be wary if they know they've allowed their fellow Minion to die by execution - they can be killed the next day if a Minstrel is in effect!
The Vizier doesn't necessarily know if good has voted and therefore doesn't know if they can force the execution, so if they try it might fail.
If a Vizier is created, all players immediately learn who the new Vizier is. If an extant Vizier is made into another character, there is no public indication of this.

A good Cult Leader can vote for everything the Vizier wants then be turned late in the game. Ditto Outsiders in a Fang Gu script (it doesnâ€™t even have to be in play for the Vizier to promise it to an Outsider) or the Goon or Politician or a player that negotiates with the Mezepheles to keep the word until later. These plays are very rarely fun, even for the players directly involved, so itâ€™s probably just worth agreeing in your group not to do so.
The Vizier doesn't necessarily know if good has voted and therefore doesn't know if they can force the execution, so if they try it might fail.
The Recluse can register as evil when the Vizier chooses to execute immediately and therefore for nothing to happen. This is rarely fun as it publicly confirms the Recluse.
Better be careful with your voting as good players!,
A Scapegoat can take an execution that the Vizier forced through.

The Spy can be the good vote that allows the Vizier to execute, but the Vizier cannot know if the Storyteller is going to allow the Spy to register as good, so cannot afford to try and force the execution based on the Spy's vote alone or they risk outing the Spy if the execution doesn't happen.
A negative vote is still a vote and, if good, can allow the Vizier to force the execution.
The Vizier can completely pollute Town Crier information by nominating freely every day â€“ script writers should consider carefully before putting both on a script.
The knowledge that the Vizier is in play is not made false.
A Good Evil Twin in a Vortox game is given correct information.
The red herring will give a 'no', as Register as is considered true.
The Grandmother learns an Evil player & a character they are not. A 'grandchild' token is placed next to a Good player & if they die at night, so does the Grandmother
A player protected by the Monk would get correct information in a Vortox game.
The Pixie is shown a not-in-play role. An arbitrary player is marked, when that player dies, they gain the shown abilities.

If Pixie is droisoned night 1, you can show them any Townsfolk token, whether in play or not. You then place the Mad token next to any player you like. When that player dies, the Pixie gains the Townsfolk ability they were shown regardless of the actual ability that player had.
The Wraith wakes when the evil Townsfolk wakes.

The Wraith wakes when other evil players wake, so if the Wraith has any living waking evil teammates, the Chambermaid learns a 1. If the Wraith does not have any alive & waking evil teammates and the Storyteller believes the Wraith has not otherwise opened their eyes, they may choose to show the Chambermaid a 0.
If the Snake Charmer becomes the evil Demon, the Wraith wakes with the new evil Demon.
If the Wraith is unable to wake at night because they are drunk or poisoned or otherwise cannot use their ability due to another character's ability, the Mathematician learns a 1.
If the Cult Leader turns evil, the Wraith wakes with the Cult Leader when they learn this. If the Cult Leader turns good, the Wraith does not wake with the Cult Leader.
The Wraith does not wake with the Lycanthrope's Faux Paw.

If a Minion is executed while there is a sober & healthy Minstrel, wake the Wraith immediately to inform them they have no ability. When the Wraith becomes sober & healthy, wake them to inform them they have their ability again.

No jinx! Since the Wraith only wakes when other evil players do, and there is no Minion & Demon info step in a Poppy Grower game, the Wraith will still struggle to identify their evil teammates at first, especially if they are evil characters who don't wake at night. And, if all evil players do wake at night early in the game, the Poppy Grower can identify that the evil team feels especially coordinate & get a great sense of which evil characters are in play.
Sadly, the Wraith cannot officially open their eyes during Organ Grinder voting. (That said, if you want to house rule it, our eyes are closed tonight...)
If the Zealot becomes a new character, they no longer have the Zealot ability and are no longer required to vote on every nomination.
If a player is made mad as the Zealot, they are expected to vote on every nomination.
If the Zealot becomes a new character, they no longer have the Zealot ability and are no longer required to vote on every nomination.
If the Marionette thinks they are the Zealot, they should always vote on every nomination.
The Zealot might be a great person to have on your side, since they have to vote on every good player! But they also have to vote on every evil player, so be careful what you wish for...
If the Zealot becomes a new character, they no longer have the Zealot ability and are no longer required to vote on every nomination.
A Lunatic who thinks they are the Zombuul is not woken up after they die, as they no longer have an ability.
The Pit-Hag's arbitrary deaths can kill the Zombuul twice in order for them to be dead.
